Description: PURPOSE  CONSTRUCT A CONSERVATION BUILDING AT THE FRESNO CHAFFEE ZOO FOR CAPTIVE PROPAGATION AND REARING OF BLUNT NOSED LEOPARD LIZARDS  GAMBELIA SILA  FOR REPATRIATION TO THE PANOCHE PLATEAU, PANOCHE HILLS, FRESNO COUNTY ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED  CONSTRUCT A BUILDING TO HOUSE A CAPTIVE PROPAGATION PROGRAM FOR BLUNT NOSED LEOPARD LIZARDS AT THE FRESNO CHAFFEE ZOO  CONSTRUCTION OF THE BUILDING WILL CONSIST OF THE FOLLOWING MAJOR COMPONENTS CONCRETE SLAB FOUNDATION ON GRADECONCRETE MASONRY UNIT WALL FRAMINGWOOD ROOF FRAMING WITH ASPHALT SHINGLESPLUMBINGMECHANICAL, HVAC, AND ELECTRICAL SYSTEMSHARDSCAPE AND LANDSCAPE WORKDELIVERABLES EXPECTED OUTCOME S   CONSTRUCTION OF A CONSERVATION BUILDING AT THE FRESNO CHAFFEE ZOO FOR CAPTIVE PROPAGATION AND REARING OF BLUNT NOSED LEOPARD LIZARDS  GAMBELIA SILA  FOR REPATRIATION TO THE PANOCHE PLATEAU, PANOCHE HILLS, FRESNO COUNTY BENEFICIARY  THE PUBLIC

1. AWARD PURPOSE:THE RECIPIENT WILL CONDUCT A PROJECT THAT WILL PROVIDE INFORMATION TO ASSIST WITH RECOVERY OF POPULATIONS OF A FEDERALLY LISTED SPECIES. THE RECOVERY OF FEDERALLY LISTED SPECIES IS IN THE PUBLIC'S INTEREST. THEREFORE, CONDUCTING THE PROJECT WILL ASSIST THE RECIPIENT IN ACCOMPLISHING ITS PUBLIC PURPOSE AND NEED ON BEHALF OF RECLAMATION. THE PROJECT IS BEING UNDERTAKEN FOR THE BENEFIT OF CVP-IMPACTED SPECIES, AND NOT PRIMARILY FOR THE BENEFIT OF RECLAMATION OR THE RECIPIENT. ANY BENEFITS TO A FEDERAL AGENCY ARE UNINTENDED AND INDIRECT.2.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: 1) DETERMINE THE EXTENT OF SPREAD AND POPULATION IMPACTS OF SARCOPTIC MANGE ON SAN JOAQUIN KIT FOXES AND DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT STRATEGIES TO CONTROL OR ELIMINATE MANGE AMONG KIT FOXES.2) DETERMINE SPATIAL PATTERNS OF EXPOSURE OF SAN JOAQUIN KIT FOXES TO CANINE DISTEMPER VIRUS AND IDENTIFY FACTORS ASSOCIATED WITH EXPOSURE (E.G., PROXIMITY TO DOMESTIC DOGS, GRAY FOXES). 3) ASSESS THE MAGNITUDE OF RISK POSED BY DISEASE TO THE CONSERVATION AND RECOVERY OF SAN JOAQUIN KIT FOXES.3.EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES:TASK 1. MANAGE OR   ELIMINATE MANGE IN SAN JOAQUIN KIT FOXES.TASK 2. SURVEY FOR OCCURRENCES OF MANGE IN KIT FOXES   OUTSIDE OF BAKERSFIELD.TASK 3. DETERMINE THE IMPACT OF MANGE ON KIT FOX   POPULATIONS AND REPRODUCTION.TASK 4. DEVELOP AND TEST TREATMENTS FOR CONTROL OF   MANGE.TASK 5. ASSESS EXPOSURE RATES, RISK FACTORS, AND POPULATION   EFFECTS OF CDV.TASK 6 - PROVIDE REPORTS AND OTHER WRITTEN PRODUCTS.4.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE RECOVERY OF FEDERALLY LISTED SPECIES IS IN THE PUBLIC'S INTEREST. THEREFORE, CONDUCTING THE PROJECT WILL ASSIST THE RECIPIENT IN ACCOMPLISHING ITS PUBLIC PURPOSE AND NEED ON BEHALF OF RECLAMATION5.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES (IF KNOWN OR SPECIFIED AT TIME OF AWARD): N/A

1. AWARD PURPOSE:THE RECIPIENT WILL CONDUCT A PROJECT THAT WILL PROVIDE INFORMATION TO ASSIST WITH RECOVERY OF POPULATIONS OF A FEDERALLY LISTED SPECIES. THE RECOVERY OF FEDERALLY LISTED SPECIES IS IN THE PUBLIC'S INTEREST. THEREFORE, CONDUCTING THE PROJECT WILL ASSIST THE RECIPIENT IN ACCOMPLISHING ITS PUBLIC PURPOSE AND NEED ON BEHALF OF RECLAMATION. THE PROJECT IS BEING UNDERTAKEN FOR THE BENEFIT OF CVP-IMPACTED SPECIES, AND NOT PRIMARILY FOR THE BENEFIT OF RECLAMATION OR THE RECIPIENT. ANY BENEFITS TO A FEDERAL AGENCY ARE UNINTENDED AND INDIRECT.2.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: 3.EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES:THE KIT FOX METAPOPULATION HAS SUFFERED A SIGNIFICANT DECLINE IN THE PAST DECADE DUE TO ANTICOAGULANT RODENTICIDES (AR) AND DISEASE (MANGE OUTBREAKS, DISTEMPER). THIS RESEARCH, WHICH LEVERAGES BOTH MODERN SAMPLES (CURRENTLY IN HAND AND UNDER CONTINUING COLLECTION) AND HISTORICAL SAMPLES COLLECTED PRIOR TO THE PROLIFERATION OF ARS AND MAJOR DISEASE OUTBREAKS, AS WELL AS FROM OUTBRED POPULATIONS (NON-ENDANGERED SUBSPECIES) FROM THE MOJAVE AND GREAT BASIN DESERTS, WILL PROVIDE THE FIRST HIGH-RESOLUTION CONNECTIVITY MAP AND A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF THE ROLE OF INBREEDING DEPRESSION IN POPULATION PERSISTENCE BOTH ON THE POPULATION AND METAPOPULATION LEVELS.4.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:BENEFITS TO THE PUBLIC FROM THE PROJECT INCLUDE PROVIDING INFORMATION ON A FEDERALLY LISTED SPECIES TO ASSIST WITH THE SPECIES' RECOVERY, WHICH IS A BENEFIT TO THE SPECIES AND THE PUBLIC. IN ADDITION, THE ACTION MEETS THE MITIGATION REQUIREMENTS CALLED FOR IN A FWS ENDANGERED SPECIES ACT BIOLOGICAL OPINION (BO) INTENDED TO ENSURE THAT THE EXISTING OPERATION OF THE CVP AND IMPLEMENTATION OF THE CENTRAL VALLEY PROJECT IMPROVEMENT ACT WOULD NOT JEOPARDIZE LISTED SPECIES OR ADVERSELY AFFECT DESIGNATED CRITICAL HABITAT. BY MEETING ITS OBLIGATIONS IN THE BO, RECLAMATION IS ABLE TO DELIVER CVP WATER FOR AGRICULTURE, MUNICIPAL, INDUSTRIAL, AND DOMESTIC USES WHICH IS A BENEFIT TO THE PUBLIC.5.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES (IF KNOWN OR SPECIFIED AT TIME OF AWARD): N/A
CENTRAL VALLEY PROJECT CONSERVATION PROGRAM FOR FISCAL YEAR 2021 AND 2022 - 2021
PRODUCING NOVEL GENOME-LEVEL RESOURCES FOR VERNAL POOL CRUSTACEANS OF CONSERVATION CONCERN IN CALIFORNIA

THROUGH THE PROJECT, THE RECIPIENT WOULD PURCHASE FROM THE LANDOWNERS A CONSERVATION EASEMENT TO BE RECORDED IN THE COUNTY OF MADERA THAT WOULD FOREVER CONSERVE AND MANAGE 3,602 ACRES OF VERNAL POOL GRASSLAND HABITATS ON THE PROPERTY TO BENEFIT FEDERAL- AND STATE-LISTED THREATENED AND ENDANGERED SPECIES INCLUDING THE CALIFORNIA TIGER SALAMANDER, VERNAL POOL FAIRY SHRIMP, HAIRY ORCUTT GRASS, SUCCULENT OWL'S CLOVER, AND OTHER CENTRAL VALLEY PROJECT (CVP) IMPACTED SENSITIVE SPECIES.
EPIDEMIOLOGICAL ATTRIBUTES OF SARCOPTIC MANGE IN A POPULATION OF SAN JOAQUIN KIT FOXES:  DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF STRATEGIES TO MITIGATE AN EPIDEMIC
BUENA VISTA LAKE SHREW CONSERVATION

THE PROJECT WILL CONSERVE AND MANAGE 356 ACRES OF VERNAL POOL GRASSLAND HABITATS FOR FEDERAL- AND STATE-LISTED THREATENED AND ENDANGERED SPECIES INCLUDING THE SAN JOAQUIN KIT FOX, CALIFORNIA TIGER SALAMANDER, VERNAL POOL FAIRY SHRIMP, CONSERVANCY FAIRY SHRIMP, VERNAL POOL TADPOLE SHRIMP, GREENE'S TUCTORIA, SUCCULENT OWL'S CLOVER, COLUSA GRASS, SAN JOAQUIN VALLEY ORCUTT GRASS, AND OTHER CVP-IMPACTED SPECIES.
